author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Election Commission officials held discussions with representative of various associations of the differently abled persons on Monday on their expectations of facilities to be provided during the ensuing Assembly polls.

Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni met representatives of over 10 associations and accepted to look into the demands and suggestions put forth by them.

“We raised various issues being faced by the differently abled. But there are also issues which they have said they get into. For instance, we wanted the Commission to issue EPIC cards, which would mention that the holder was a differently-abled person,” S. Namburajan, State General Secretary, Tamil Nadu Association for the Rights of All Types of Differently Abled & Caregivers (TARATDAC) said.

EC assurance

The Commission has agreed to look into the demands of transporting differently abled persons to polling stations in hilly areas, allow their vehicles close to the polling stations, among others. Some of the other issues raised during the meeting were ramps and wheelchairs for the differently-abled, escorts accompanying them to be allowed up to polling booth, Braille in Tamil for visually-impaired.
title: CEO meets forums of differently abled
